relation: Read your textbooks! Listen in class and then go home and go over the slides while taking notes! Do not try and write down notes from the slides while the teacher is talking in class or else you will not hear anything he/she has to say.

NYIT is a neat/tidy campus. The help is always on task, and they are able to assist you with all your needs readily. Most teachers get straight to the point and actually take their time out to teach you (disregarding a few).

textAfterTable: Will learn a lot I was truly impressed by innovative facilities and how my questions were answered in a friendly manner. I was impressed by their well-presented computer-engineering workshop. The teachers explained everything on what to do and what not. They also helped you if you need any. But that was a computer engineering teacher so i don't know if every teachers are like that for every major. Login to rate or flag the reviews Brittany from New Hyde Park, NY 08/05/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 2 of 29 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you are a free thinker, NYIT is for you. NYIT is very culturally diverse and students are exposed to different cultures, religions, and belief systems that will expand their own knowledge of who they are. NYIT is also for the hard workers as passion is a requirement for each major. Students are expected to give their all in everything they do.
